title: Thunderbird synchronization
content:
If I have synchronized my email host to Thunderbird locally, THEN switch to a new email host (where my IMAP on the new host is empty), will Thunderbird then synchronize everything stored locally from the old host UP to my new host? Assuming, of course, that I change my connection settings in Thunderbird from my old host to my new email host.

I am transitioning from Google Workspace to an IMAP email hosted by InMotion Hosting. Wish me luck.
creator: chuckwb9

title: Incoming server already exists.
content:
Hi,


Thunderbird: 142.0 (64-bit)

With Account Hub

When I try to add a mail account that I deleted before, I receive an error message:

  • Error Creating Account
  • Incoming server already exists.

When I add my email account, I receive the message, "Can't find a server," and Thunderbird adds the incoming server configuration somewhere. It's not in the "Account Settings" menu.

Without Account Hub

I deleted my profile folder and started from scratch.

I tried to use the same configuration settings I have in the mobile version of Thunderbird, but without success. Unfortunately, it's not possible to import the settings from Thunderbird Mobile.

I have the same problem with the Account Hub, or without it. How can I fix this problem?

Many thanks,

title: Error updating Pop3 email account
content:
Hi Support,

have been running Thunderbird for half a year, no issues, suddently last week, I get an error on one of my POP3 accounts in same Thunderbird program.

Error reads "Kunne ikke skrive mailen i mailmappen. Sørg for at du har skriverettigheder til filsystemet, og at du har nok diskpladstil at kopiere mailmappen"

According to my provider, it is a problem with my email program.

I have tried to compress, archieve to generate more room, even restartet, program and computer. Still same issue. Still have 23 GB of free disk spare on my drive.

Any ideas

Marinus
creator: marinus6

title: The messages could not be moved or copied to folder 'MyFolder on Local Folders' because writing to folder failed.
content:
Hi.

Every and each time I try to move any message to my local folders, or make any change on it, I get that error message. I can create new folders inside my Local Folders (for instance, a Test folder) and I can still access the messages stored there, but I can not make any further change.

I have tried these things so far:

1 - Check that I have enough space on the partition. 2 - Check the access privileges (I have set them to Total Control to all users). 3 - Compact all mail folders. 4 - Repair all mail folders. 5 - Rename the Local Folders to "Local Folders.old" and create a new one. 6 - Place the local folders in a different drive. 7 - Recreate the profile, either by copying the files manually and by importing them. 8 - Delete all local folders' .msf files (to rebuild indexes) 9 - Uninstall and reinstall Thunderbird from scratch to the last version - 142.0 (64-bit) 10 - Revert the last W10 system update. 11 - Check the antivirus configuration. 12 - Recover an old backup of my Mail folder (done when there was no error). 13 - Delete the entire disk data partition, reformat and recover it.

The error persists and I have run out of ideas.

Could someone help me, please? At my local folders I have years of messages that I still browse, and I use them as a local archive.

Thank you very much in advance.

Iskandar.
creator: iskandar.101

title: BUG ? XML anchor displayed in Thunderbird
content:
Hello,

When I receive e-mails with this content :

<xml> 

    <o:officedocumentsettings>                <o:allowpng></o:AllowPNG>                <o:pixelsperinch>96</o:PixelsPerInch>           </o:OfficeDocumentSettings>

</xml>

The "96" (from <o:pixelsperinch>) is displayed in the HTML view in Thunderbird ! Is that normal ?

Thanks Fred Pralong

title: Thunderbird on Ubuntu 22.04 keeps "not responding" sometimes locks up pc

This has happened far more often in the last few months than it did previously. It can happen after opening new mail or after opening mail saved in Local Folders. I run updates as often as I am notified that they are available. The only extension listed is Import Export Tools. I just disabled that, since I wasn't aware that it was running.

title: LDAP Address Book does not work when composing a message
content:
LDAP Address Book is configured to access Active Directory with a bind login, port 636. Directory works while in Address Book tab: searching for names returns results. No errors in Developers' Error Console.

Address search/autocompletion does not work while in message compose window. Directory is selected in Account Settings > Addressing. Error Console shows:

mailnews.ldap: error { target: TCPSocket, isTrusted: true, name: "ConnectionRefusedError", message: "Network", errorCode: 2152398861, srcElement: TCPSocket, currentTarget: TCPSocket, eventPhase: 2, bubbles: false, cancelable: false, … } (LDAPClient.sys.mjs:264:18) ​ It also shows 'port: 0', perhaps should use port: 636.

target: TCPSocket { host: "xxx.xxx.xxx", port: 0, ssl: true, … } ​ Is this a known issue? Is there a fix/workaround? Thunderbird 142.0 (64-bit) on Debian Sid.
creator: sarunas.burdulis

NEW PROBLEM STARTED at that time; NOW Thunderbird no longer downloads my emails, or sends any. I try to send a test email, and I get an "smtp.gmail.com error"
